info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 10 at 8:22AM EDT until October 10 at 9:15AM EDT by NWS Key West FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Portions of the Lower and Middle Keys
* WHEN...Until 915 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 818 AM EDT, National Weather Service Meteorologist detected heavy rain due to thunderstorms, in conjunction with seasonal King Tide coastal flooding. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marathon, Bahia Honda Channel Bridge, Spanish Harbor Channel Bridge, West End Of Seven Mile Bridge, Niles Channel Bridge, Seven Mile Bridge, East End Of Seven Mile Bridge, Big Pine Key, Bahia Honda Key and Ohio Key. - This includes US 1 between mile markers 16 and 62. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM EDT THIS MORNING
